channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10238] TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown
item.description:
In TestAccessController#verifyDenied there is code attempting to deal with UTEs with AccessDeniedException as a nested cause. Although it would seem the code intends to handle the exception reported by a recently failed test on the 0.98 Hadoop 1.1 Jenkins build here:

java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException: Unknown exception in doAs

Caused by: java.security.PrivilegedActionException: com.google.protobuf.ServiceException: Error calling method PingService.noop

Caused by: com.google.protobuf.ServiceException: Error calling method PingService.noop

Caused by: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.AccessDeniedExceptionorg.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.AccessDeniedException: Insufficient permissions (user=UserB, scope=testCoprocessorExec, family=, action=EXEC)

Caused by: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RemoteWithExtrasException: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.AccessDeniedException: Insufficient permissions (user=UserB, scope=testCoprocessorExec, family=, action=EXEC)

...

it didn't work properly.
item.summary: TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Too bad we don't have precommit builds against Hadoop 1.1
If Hadoop QA comes back ok, and it should, then I am going to commit this change to unbreak a Jenkins build.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12620404/10238.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12620404

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8283//console

This message is automatically generated.

I've tried reproducing this locally with 100 reps under Hadoop 2 and Hadoop 1.1 with no luck. HadoopQA result with patch here is good so I'm going to commit to trunk and 0.98 to see if this addresses the Christmastime coal that ASF Jenkins delivered into my stocking.
Committed to trunk and 0.98. Will reopen if further work is needed according to ASF Jenkins results.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #35 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/35/)
HBASE-10238. TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown (apurtell: rev 1553412)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestAccessController.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #4758 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/4758/)
HBASE-10238. TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown (apurtell: rev 1553411)

  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestAccessController.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #34 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/34/)
HBASE-10238. TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown (apurtell: rev 1553412)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestAccessController.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-1.1 #23 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-1.1/23/)
HBASE-10238. TestAccessController#verifyDenied can fail even if ADE is thrown (apurtell: rev 1553411)

  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestAccessController.java

I can see this is failing again on the Jenkins 0.98 on 1.1 build. I can't reproduce it locally and am not able to get the exact incantation for the twisty exception construction. Reverting but leaving open for later.

A bit more information. Using JDK 6, specifically Oracle JDK 6u43, I can reproduce the problem running under Surefire. Yet with the same JDK, when I switch to Eclipse, set a breakpoint in TestAccessController where it catches the UndeclaredThrowableException, and then step through the code, everything looks good and the test completes.

Resolving as invalid, I was barking up the wrong tree.
